page.title: 18Oystermouth Castle
page.content:
Oystermouth Castle was first built of wood around the year 1100 by the Normans. Later in the 13th Century it was rebuilt of local stone.
As you enter the Castle you notice that it is built on a hill so that the people who lived in it could see if any enemies were coming. Today, from the ruins you can still see right round Swansea Bay as far as the Pier and the Lighthouse on Mumbles Head.
When we visited the Castle we entered through the Gatehouse and saw the "Murder Hole" through which the defenders threw missiles at their attackers. We explored the keep, guard-room, White Lady's Chamber, Chapel,kitchens and down the spiral steps to the dungeons.
